New Records: Jayson Tatum scored 33 points and nine rebounds, while Payton Pritchard scored six points in overtime to lead the Boston Celtics to a 108-104 win over the Brooklyn Nets.
Key Match Events: Cameron Johnson was fouled by Jayson Tatum after missing a wide open 3-point attempt in the closing seconds of regulation but grabbed his own miss and made two free throws to tie the game at 94 with 7.6 seconds left. Tatum front-rimmed a 3 as time expired, sending it to overtime.
Pre-Game Insights: The Nets coach Jordi Fernandez mentioned that the game would be exciting because both teams like to run, so they focused on defensive strategies deep in the backcourt. The Celtics, coming off their first home loss of the season against the Golden State Warriors, relied on their fast break to outscore the Nets 20-10 in transition.
Post-Match Reflections: Celtics coach mentioned the victory as a crucial step toward the championship and highlighted the team's effort despite missing key players like Jaylen Brown and Luke Kornet due to injuries.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics were held below their league-leading average of 19 3-pointers made per game, shooting 14 for 53 from deep. The Nets made 10 3-pointers. The game was the 100th meeting between the two rival teams.
Others: The Nets are set to play the Cavaliers on Saturday night, and the Celtics will face the Milwaukee Bucks on Sunday.
